file_content.text: Nem'ro will deal with Fa'athra soon enough.
Hello, Toth'lazhen. The Red Blade claims to have something to show you.
I do not have time for your games, Rattataki. Leave us to our business.
What did you find? Did you learn the identity of Fa'athra's supporters?
I stole these recordings from Fa'athra's palace. Take a look.
This disc has answers.
Turns out your suspicions were right. Fa'athra cut a deal with the Republic.
I did.
And you base this on--what? A holodisc?
You better be paying well, Toth'lazhen. I went through a lot to get this disc.
For enough credits, sure.
These--these are Fa'athra's archives! All his bargains, all his contracts are on this disc! We can do much with this information...
These--these are Fa'athra's archives! All his bargains, all his contracts are on this disc! A pity about the damage--but some of these recordings still function....
Mighty Nem'ro! I have news of Fa'athra's attack on the palace.
I saw, foolish Toth'lazhen. I pay attention to what goes on in my palace, even when my mind is occupied.
So! Fa'athra is allied with the Republic and has employed Republic men to fight my clan.
That's what it looks like. What are you going to do?
Indeed.
You'll need help to stay competitive. But the Republic does have enemies. They might be useful.
Time to find allies.
Yes. And use them we will.
Looks like I should've gone to work for Fa'athra.
Time to cut my losses and go.
The Blade thinks Fa'athra will win this! No--this is not the case.
Fa'athra would involve the Cartel in politics? Then we will involve the Cartel in politics! We will make alliances. We will grow stronger.
In return for your assistance, Blade, generous payment will be transferred to your accounts.
Yes, you have done well by my house. You will be rewarded.
A pleasure doing business with you, mighty Nem'ro.
Thank you.
You earned your payment, little pirate.
Is there anything else I can do for you or your clan?
Can I help any more?
No. Our business is done.
I don't need a Hutt's gratitude.
Whatever.
Perhaps not--but you could acknowledge the honor.
Now be on your way. Nem'ro and I have much to discuss.
Much to discuss. And revenge to plot....
Don't you think we should get those holorecordings altered before we give them to Toth'lazhen?
Do not waste my time unless you know who is helping Fa'athra.
Fa'athra murders my lieutenant? In my own house? How, Toth'lazhen? Tell me how Fa'athra does this!
The guards report finding many bodies, great Nem'ro, and the slicers are examining the technology involved. They say--
Do not echo the slicers to me! Find out, Toth'lazhen--I tell you to find out how, you find out how.
Do not disturb me until then! I must think on this.
Yes, great Nem'ro.
You! Blade! I assumed you'd been killed by the men who came for Karrels Javis. It seems I underestimated you.
You! Blade! I assumed you'd been disintegrated along with Karrels Javis. It seems I underestimated you.
What are you talking about? Karrels is dead?
What happened?
Yes, along with his bodyguards. A disturbing development--you are fortunate to have survived.
Sounds like you're having trouble with Nem'ro.
Your boss yelling again?
Nem'ro is deeply concerned about the violence in his palace. But his words are for me, as mine are for you.
Yeah, it's great seeing you, too.
Hey, buddy.
I do not appreciate your style of humor, Blade.
I know you gave Karrels assistance in his attacks on Fa'athra. I suspect those attacks are what doomed him.
But I respect your talents. If you wish to be part of the Nem'ro clan's response to this incident--for your own safety, and to "avenge" your friend--I would allow it.
I'll do whatever it takes to bring the killers to justice.
I'm in.
Good. You are truly an honorable individual.
I didn't help Karrels for free. Are you going to pay me for my time?
Is this a job?
If you assist us, you will be rewarded. That is the way of the Nem'ro clan.
You're too kind, Toth'lazhen--really.
Gee, thanks.
Yes, it is true that I am known for my kindness.
This assault by Fa'athra is unprecedented, but we should not be surprised by his boldness; he hires more mercenaries and bounty hunters daily.
Now I fear he has outside help. During the assault, our surveillance monitors were disabled using Republic protocols and technology.
Would the Republic really help Fa'athra?
The Republic's involved?
Karrels Javis misunderstood many things, but he was correct in his estimate of the Republic. It is desperate, capable of many unlikely actions.
Fa'athra could've bought the technology anywhere--doesn't prove he's in bed with the Republic.
That doesn't mean much.
True. Perhaps he has a contact inside Republic security, or a slicer who can duplicate Republic programs. However, I want to be prepared.
What's your point?
Yeah? So?
If Fa'athra has brokered a deal with Republic politicians, we will need to answer his newfound strength.
I must know for certain who is helping Fa'athra. Find out what I need, Blade--speak to your contacts and your "business partners." Find Karrels's killers.
I'll look into it. Might take some time.
All right.
Remember--if Fa'athra thought Karrels was worth killing, your life may also be at stake.
I wouldn't even know where to start.
How?
Nor I, but the underworld respects you. Men may say things to you that they fear to say to Nem'ro.
I think I liked working with Karrels better.
You're a real pain.
I also preferred working with Karrels--and I did not like Karrels.
Now speak to your allies. We must resolve this affair.
Karrels has retired to his suites, Blade. If he is taking visitors, you can find him elsewhere in the palace.
I do not have time for you, Blade. If you wish someone's attention, speak to Karrels.
My time is Nem'ro's, creature--don't waste it.
I have very important business. You are not part of it.
Ha! Ha!
